org.jacktheclipper.frontend.utils

Class AuthenticationUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jacktheclipper.frontend.utils.AuthenticationUtils

  • public class AuthenticationUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A Utility class for everything concerning Authentication. Only works if the authentication has a principal object of type User

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      AuthenticationUtils()

    • Constructor Detail

        public AuthenticationUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • getUserId

        public static java.util.UUID getUserId(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                       java.lang.NullPointerException
        Extracts the user's UUID from the given authentication token. This is such a common occurrence (since the backend uses the id to check permissions) that this utility method saves a lot of typing and casting around
        Parameters:
        auth - The authentication token holding the user object
        Returns:
        The user's UUID
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the authentication object is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the authentication does not hold a principal of type User

      • getOrganization

        public static java.lang.String getOrganization(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                               java.lang.NullPointerException
        Extracts the user's organization from the given authentication token. This is used frequently during the authentication process. One example where it's used is to determine to which login page a user should be redirected to after he logs out
        Parameters:
        auth - the authentication token encapsulating the user
        Returns:
        the organization the user belongs to
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the authentication object is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the authentication does not hold a principal of type User

      • getEmail

        public static java.lang.String getEmail(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                        java.lang.NullPointerException
        Extracts the user's email address from the supplied authentication token.
        Parameters:
        auth - The authentication token encapsulating the user
        Returns:
        The user's email address
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If Authentication.getPrincipal() does not return an Object of type User
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the authentication parameter is null

      • isMustChangePassword

        public static boolean isMustChangePassword(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                           java.lang.NullPointerException
        Extracts whether a user should change his password. The method acts like a standard getter and thus does the same as User.isMustChangePassword(). Due to the Authentication using Object to store the principal this also makes accessing easier and prevents casting errors
        Parameters:
        auth - The authentication token encapsulating the user
        Returns:
        Whether the user should change his password. This is true if he recently reset his password via UserService.resetPassword(String) or the user was created by a UserRole.StaffChief. Otherwise false is returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the authentication object is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the authentication does not hold a principal of type User
